meanings.definition: having a musty or unpleasant smell
meanings.sent1: The old basement was fuggier than the rest of the house.
meanings.sent2: The damp clothes in the laundry basket were getting fuggier by the day.
meanings.sent3: The fuggier socks in the gym bag made everyone hold their noses.
meanings.sent4: The fuggier scent of decay hung in the air like a heavy fog.
meanings.sent5: The fuggier stench of the garbage bin made my eyes water.

meanings.sent1: The room cleared out when the fuggier entered.
meanings.sent2: The fuggier at the bus stop made everyone move away.
meanings.sent3: The fuggier was oblivious to the effect of their odor on others.
meanings.sent4: The fuggier stood out in the crowd like a skunk at a picnic.
meanings.sent5: The fuggier's presence was unmistakable in the small elevator.

meanings.sent1: The garbage began to fuggier in the summer heat.
meanings.sent2: The old cheese started to fuggier after being left out.
meanings.sent3: The socks fuggiered in the gym bag, much to everyone's dismay.
meanings.sent4: The alley behind the restaurant fuggiered with the smell of rotting food.
meanings.sent5: The swamp fuggiered with the scent of decaying vegetation.
